Towards an EU Strategy on Artificial Intelligence in Science - Council Conclusions

This document represents the Council conclusions adopted by the Council of the European Union on 23 May 2025, concerning the development of an EU Strategy on Artificial Intelligence in Science. The conclusions stem from a series of prior deliberations, including the Council‚Äôs 2021 conclusions on the Future Governance of the European Research Area (ERA), the 2022 conclusions on the New European Innovation Agenda, and the 2024 conclusions regarding the European Court of Auditors‚Äô Special Report on EU Artificial Intelligence ambition. Specifically, the document emphasizes the need for coordinated efforts, scaled-up investments, and improved access to digital infrastructure to support AI development. It references the Commission‚Äôs Coordinated Plan on Artificial Intelligence, which aims to align Member States‚Äô strategies with EU priorities. The Council acknowledges the importance of the Scientific Advice Mechanism and its evidence review reports. The overarching theme is a call for a strategic, coordinated approach to AI development within the European Union, reflecting a recognition of the significant investment and governance required to realize the potential of AI in scientific endeavors. The document‚Äôs purpose is to formally endorse and guide the EU‚Äôs strategy in this critical area, building upon existing frameworks and addressing key concerns highlighted by the European Court of Auditors. The conclusions are a formal endorsement of a strategic direction for AI research and development within the EU, aligning with broader European innovation and research goals.
